forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain after 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 48, with temperatures rising to around 50 overnight. South wind around 5 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%.

forecast.name: Wednesday
forecast.detailedForecast: Drizzle likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 58 in the afternoon. South wind 6 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the city drifts into the early hours, the sky above San Francisco is a tapestry of shifting clouds, holding the promise of rain in the stillness of night. The gentle sigh of the south wind whispers through the streets, heralding a cool morning that nestles in around 48 degrees with a subtle rise to 50 as dawn approaches. When the sun finally greets the city, it will struggle against a dense blanket of clouds, offering little warmth to the day ahead.

By mid-morning, expect a likelihood of drizzle to punctuate the thick cloud cover, creating a soft murmur against the pavement—a sound both refreshing and indicative of the moisture-rich air that flows in from the bay. Visibility may be slightly muted, particularly where the fog creeps in from the coast, forming a gentle embrace around the iconic Golden Gate. The high will hover near 62 degrees before retreating to 58 in the afternoon, offsetting any warmth brought by fleeting moments of clarity. Layers are recommended, with a snug jacket to fend off the brisk winds gusting from 6 to 18 mph, and perhaps an umbrella should an unexpected shower emerge.

Given the atmospheric conditions and the damp chill, a leisurely morning at a local café might be just the reprieve one needs—where the comfort of coffee intertwines with thoughtful conversation. A stroll along the Embarcadero could also provide a serene backdrop, with the muted hues of the city painting a picture of quiet beauty, while the contemplative drizzle adds a poetic touch to the urban landscape. As daylight wanes, cozying up with a good book at home might become the preferred sanctuary as the evening unfurls and the city lights begin to flicker to life.
